questions.question: What is the primary format of the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: A narrative account of Jesus' life
A collection of sayings attributed to Jesus
A series of letters to early Christian communities
A prophetic vision of the end times
questions.answer: A collection of sayings attributed to Jesus

questions.question: How many sayings are contained in the Gospel of Thomas?
Where was the Gospel of Thomas discovered?
choices: Dead Sea Scrolls
Vatican Archives
Nag Hammadi library
Qumran Caves
questions.answer: Nag Hammadi library

questions.question: In what language was the discovered version of the Gospel of Thomas written?
choices: Greek
Aramaic
Hebrew
Coptic
questions.answer: Coptic

questions.question: What term is used to describe the type of gospel that the Gospel of Thomas represents?
choices: Narrative gospel
Epistolary gospel
Sayings gospel
Apocalyptic gospel
questions.answer: Sayings gospel

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key theme in the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: Self-knowledge
The kingdom of God as a present reality
The crucifixion and resurrection of Jesus
Transformation and spiritual awakening
questions.answer: The crucifixion and resurrection of Jesus

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Thomas portray the kingdom of God?
choices: As a future event
As a physical place
As a present reality
As a political kingdom
questions.answer: As a present reality

questions.question: What is the significance of the opening statement in the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: It establishes the text as a historical account
It claims the sayings are secret teachings from Jesus
It identifies the author as one of the twelve apostles
It dates the composition of the text
questions.answer: It claims the sayings are secret teachings from Jesus

questions.question: Which concept is emphasized as a path to salvation in the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: Faith alone
Good works
Self-knowledge
Ritual observance
questions.answer: Self-knowledge

questions.question: What term is often associated with the type of knowledge emphasized in the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: Sophia
Gnosis
Logos
Pistis
questions.answer: Gnosis

questions.question: How does the structure of the Gospel of Thomas differ from canonical gospels?
choices: It includes more parables
It has a clear chronological order
It lacks a narrative framework
It focuses more on Jesus' miracles
questions.answer: It lacks a narrative framework

questions.question: What is notably absent from the Gospel of Thomas compared to canonical gospels?
choices: Parables
Sayings of Jesus
Mention of the disciples
Passion narrative
questions.answer: Passion narrative

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between the Gospel of Thomas and canonical gospels?
choices: They are completely different with no overlap
They share some sayings but have significant differences
They are identical in content and structure
The Gospel of Thomas is a summary of the canonical gospels
questions.answer: They share some sayings but have significant differences

questions.question: What is the 'Q source' in relation to the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: Another name for the Gospel of Thomas
A hypothetical collection of sayings used by Matthew and Luke
The original Greek version of Thomas
A commentary on the Gospel of Thomas
questions.answer: A hypothetical collection of sayings used by Matthew and Luke

questions.question: Which statement best reflects the scholarly debate about the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: All scholars agree it predates the canonical gospels
It is universally accepted as a Gnostic text
There is debate about its date of composition and relationship to early Christianity
Scholars unanimously reject its historical value
questions.answer: There is debate about its date of composition and relationship to early Christianity

questions.question: What does the Gospel of Thomas suggest about the nature of spiritual transformation?
choices: It occurs through ritual observance
It involves a radical change in perspective
It is only possible after death
It requires adherence to strict moral laws
questions.answer: It involves a radical change in perspective

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Thomas generally present Jesus?
choices: As a political revolutionary
As a dispenser of hidden wisdom
As a miracle worker
As a suffering messiah
questions.answer: As a dispenser of hidden wisdom

questions.question: What concept does the Gospel of Thomas emphasize regarding the divine?
choices: The Trinity
God's wrath and judgment
The kingdom as an inner reality
The need for animal sacrifices
questions.answer: The kingdom as an inner reality

questions.question: Which of the following parables appears in both the Gospel of Thomas and the canonical gospels?
choices: The Prodigal Son
The Good Samaritan
The Mustard Seed
The Rich Man and Lazarus
questions.answer: The Mustard Seed

questions.question: What does the Gospel of Thomas suggest about the role of women in spiritual matters?
choices: Women are excluded from spiritual knowledge
Women must become male to enter the kingdom
Women have equal access to spiritual wisdom
Women are superior to men in spiritual matters
questions.answer: Women have equal access to spiritual wisdom

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Thomas view the material world?
choices: As inherently good and to be embraced
As neutral and unimportant
As something to be rejected or transcended
As the only reality that matters
questions.answer: As something to be rejected or transcended

questions.question: What is the significance of the name 'Didymos Judas Thomas' in the opening of the text?
choices: It identifies the author as the apostle Thomas
It's a pseudonym for Jesus himself
It refers to a well-known scribe of the time
It's a symbolic name representing wisdom
questions.answer: It identifies the author as the apostle Thomas

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Thomas generally present salvation?
choices: As achieved through faith in Jesus' death and resurrection
As attained through correct interpretation of scripture
As realized through inner spiritual knowledge and transformation
As granted only to a predestined elect
questions.answer: As realized through inner spiritual knowledge and transformation

questions.question: What is the significance of the number 114 in relation to the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: It's the age of the author when writing the text
It's the number of disciples mentioned in the text
It's the total number of sayings in the gospel
It's a symbolic number representing completeness
questions.answer: It's the total number of sayings in the gospel

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the style of Jesus' sayings in the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: Long, detailed narratives
Poetic hymns and songs
Short, often cryptic aphorisms
Systematic theological arguments
questions.answer: Short, often cryptic aphorisms

questions.question: What is the general scholarly consensus on the original language of the Gospel of Thomas?
choices: It was originally written in Coptic
It was originally written in Greek
It was originally written in Aramaic
There is no consensus on the original language
questions.answer: It was originally written in Greek

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Thomas typically introduce each saying?
choices: With a description of the setting
With the phrase 'Jesus said'
With a question from a disciple
With a reference to Old Testament scripture
questions.answer: With the phrase 'Jesus said'

questions.question: What is the significance of the Gospel of Thomas for understanding early Christianity?
choices: It proves that all early Christians were Gnostics
It shows the diversity of early Christian thought and literature
It disproves the authenticity of the canonical gospels
It provides a complete biography of Jesus
questions.answer: It shows the diversity of early Christian thought and literature

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Thomas generally view the concept of time and eschatology?
choices: It focuses on a future judgment day
It emphasizes the present moment and immediate spiritual realization
It predicts specific dates for the end times
It denies the existence of time altogether
questions.answer: It emphasizes the present moment and immediate spiritual realization

questions.question: What is the significance of the Gospel of Thomas for contemporary spirituality?
choices: It is irrelevant to modern religious practice
It provides a blueprint for organized church structures
It resonates with those seeking personal spiritual insight and transformation
It offers detailed predictions about the future
questions.answer: It resonates with those seeking personal spiritual insight and transformation
